definition: to advise/to urge/to try to persuade/to exhort/to console/to soothe

sentences.english: She expostulated with her husband on his habit of smoking in bed.
sentences.chinese: 她对丈夫在床上抽烟习惯提出规劝。

sentences.english: I eschewed upbraiding, I curtailed remonstrance.
In 2010, generalized concerns and exhortations will not suffice.
sentences.chinese: 在2010年，笼统的关注和规劝是不够的。

sentences.english: We advised the burglar to surrender himself to the police.
sentences.chinese: 我们规劝窃贼向警方投案自首。

sentences.english: The people marvelled at my boldness, and counsel-led me to flee from the city.
sentences.chinese: 人们皆被我的大胆惊倒，规劝我逃出城去。

sentences.english: If we can accept others' remonstrance, we are both virtuous and tolerant.
sentences.chinese: 能接受规劝，更是有德有量。

sentences.english: It depends on exasperating and uncertain instruments of persuasion and democratic decision making.
sentences.chinese: 手段是叫人气愤而且毫无把握的规劝说服和民主决策。

sentences.english: The father expostulate with his son about the foolishness of leaving school.
sentences.chinese: 父亲就他孩子辍学的愚蠢行为对他进行规劝。

sentences.english: Her mother expostulated with her about the evils of gambling.
sentences.chinese: 她母亲就赌博的害处规劝她。

sentences.english: Moreover, but also has some taunts and the admonishment sound.
sentences.chinese: 另外，还有一些嘲讽和规劝的声音。

sentences.english: We advise you to retreat before you are dealt a disaster.
sentences.chinese: 在这灾难发生之前，我们规劝你们速速撤兵。

sentences.english: He would listen to no expostulations. He left his wife and his office.
sentences.chinese: 他不听任何人的规劝，就离开了妻子，离开了办公室。

sentences.english: Although many times to persuade the son of Master Chen, I hope he will not be obsessed with video games.
sentences.chinese: 虽然陈师傅规劝多次儿子，希望他不要再痴迷电游。

sentences.english: I heard Mother remonstrating with Father about his selfishness.
sentences.chinese: 我听见母亲在规劝父亲别只顾自己不管别人。

sentences.english: She expostulated with her husband on [about] his habit of smoking in bed.
sentences.chinese: 她规劝其丈夫改掉在床上吸烟的习惯。

sentences.english: Alas, I know all warning is vain.
sentences.chinese: 啊，我知道一切规劝警诫都是徒劳的。

definition: earnest and well-meaning advice (idiom); to persuade patiently
to advise/to urge/to try to persuade/to exhort/to console/to soothe
variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
to advise and teach/to persuade and instruct
to talk sb round/to straighten sth out/to enlighten
